file_content.text: Ziost. The world where everything changed. For me, you... the galaxy.
You killed every living being here.
They died opening my eyes to the truth. I have passed beyond death's reach.
Everything dies. Even you.
That's a lie.
You have my attention...
That's a secret I'd be interested in--if I believed you.
I could use a little immortality before I die of carbon poisoning. Teach me.
Show me your truth, too.
Perhaps one day I will.
Our flesh is not who we are. Voices... Hands... Children... I no longer require those crude vessels. At long last I am truly free.
Your freedom cost millions of innocent lives. You're nothing but a monster.
You murdering lunatic.
I am a part of you, now more than ever.
Will you be free when the carbonite poisoning kills me?
That makes one of us.
Perhaps. But that is not my goal.
You choose to visit me. Why?
What do you want?
Our story is not finished.
I have done all I can to preserve your life.
Why would you do that?
You are a part of me I wish to keep.
I cannot save you unless you want to live.
I don't need your help.
There is no death. There is only the Force.
I can take this heap of slag alone.
Sith do not beg for rescue. Through passion, I gain strength.
I will decide my fate, not you.
Show me.
You can destroy it. Help me.
Share your power with me.
Not yet. But soon....
Care to put that claim to the test?
You will not be disappointed.
It is your nature to doubt. I will convince you.
Both Jedi and Sith have sought immortality. What makes you the exception?
I am not hindered by the teachings of failures.
